content.question: If <math alttext="y equals, the natural log of, open parenthesis, 2 times x squared, minus, 3 times y squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 times x squared, minus 3 times y squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 4 x, and denominator 2 times x squared, minus 3 times y squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 4 x minus 6 y, and denominator 2 times x squared, minus 3 times y squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 4 x, and denominator 2 times x squared, minus 3 times y squared, plus 6 y, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 4 x, and denominator 2 times x squared, minus 3 times y squared, plus 6 y, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
